subtitleNullable: New Zealand Rainfall data from 1960 to 2019
descriptionNullable:
Rain is imperative for life – it supplies the water we got to drink and to grow our food, keeps biological systems sound, and supplies our power. New Zealand’s precipitous territory and area within the thundering forties mean precipitation shifts over the nation. Changes in precipitation sum or timing can essentially influence agribusiness, energy, entertainment, and the environment. For illustration, an increment or diminish of precipitation in spring can have stamped impacts on crops or fish populaces.

### Content
The dataset consists of 3 data, i.e
- Daily data : consists of data columns like Location, date, Rainfall (in mm), and agent number
- State data : consists of data columns like agent number, season, precipitation, period start, period end, latitude, longitude, site, anomaly, and reference period
- Trend data : consists of data columns like agent number, season, trend likelihood( whether its likely to rain or not), period start, period end, P value, slope value, low confidence level, high confidence level, overall confidence level, intercept, R Squared value, sigma, trend method , n, note, s, variable s, tau, z, alternative, latitude, longitude and site
 
### Acknowledgements
Dataset Source: https://www.stats.govt.nz/indicators/rainfall


### Inspiration
 This data can be used to monitor rainfall and prevent potential wild fires and prepare for irrigation if drought is going to hit in that particular region
